name: Cocos2d for HTML5
description: Cocos2d for Web Browsers. Built using JavaScript.

name: Cocos2d-x
description: Multi-platform framework for building 2d games, interactive books, demos and other graphical applications. It is based on cocos2d-iphone, but instead of using Objective-C, it uses C++. It works on iOS, Android, Windows Phone, macOS, Windows and Linux.

name: Crafty
description: JavaScript game library that can help you create games in a structured way.

name: CutJavaScript
description: Lightweight and fast 2D HTML5 rendering engine for cross-platform game development.

name: Dash
description: Free and open 3D game engine written in D.

name: Duality
description: 2D Game Development Framework.

name: EaselJavaScript
description: Library to make working with the Canvas element easier.

name: EntityJavaScript
description: HTML5 JavaScript game engine utlizing the entity-component design.

name: Evennia MUD/MU* Creation System
description: Library for creating online multiplayer text games (MUD, MUSH, MUX, MUCK, MOO etc) in pure Python.

name: Flare
description: Free/Libre Action Roleplaying Engine.

name: Flashpunk
description: Free ActionScript 3 library designed for developing 2D Flash games.

name: Flixel
description: Game-making library written entirely in ActionScript 3.

name: GameJavaScript
description: GameJs is a JavaScript library for writing 2D games or other interactive graphic applications for the HTML Canvas inspired by PyGame.

name: GamePlay
description: Cross-platform, C++ game framework/engine for creating 2D/3D mobile and desktop games.

name: GemRB
description: Cross-platform implementation of Bioware's Infinity Engine.

name: GenesisEngine
description: GenesisEngine allows you to create and explore procedurally-generated planetary systems, from ground level all the way out into space. Experiments with procedurally-generated worlds, XNA, and design patterns.

name: Gladiator 3D
description: Canvas based JavaScript ray casting engine for pseudo 3D games.

name: Godot
description: Fully featured, MIT licensed, game engine. It focuses on having great tools, and a visual oriented workflow that can export to PC, Mobile and Web platforms with no hassle. The editor, language and APIs are feature rich, yet simple to learn, allowing you to become productive in a matter of hours.

name: HaxeFlixel
description: Free, cross-platform 2D game engine powered by Haxe and OpenFL.

name: JiGS
description: Online RPG and Trading Game Engine built in PHP.

name: JMonkeyEngine
description: Cutting edge, cross-platform 3D game engine for adventurous Java developers.

name: Kiwi.js
description: Blazingly fast mobile & desktop browser based HTML5 game framework. It uses CocoonJavaScript for publishing to the AppStore.

name: LibGDX
description: Desktop/Android/HTML5/iOS Java game development framework.

name: LibRocket
description: C++ user interface package based on the HTML and CSS standards. It is designed as a complete solution for any project's interface needs.

name: LibSDL2pp
description: C++11 bindings for SDL 2.0.

name: LycheeJavaScript
description: Free HTML5 + native OpenGL Game Engine for Embedded, Console, Mobile, Server and Desktop.

name: Matter.js
description: Matter.js is a JavaScript 2D rigid body physics engine for the web.

name: MelonJavaScript
description: HTML5 game framework for 2D games.

name: MonoGame
description: XNA Implementation for Mono based platforms (supports iOS, Android, Linux, and started work on PS Suite and NaCli ).

name: Oimo.js
description: Lightweight 3d physics engine for JavaScript.

name: OpenRTS
description: Real-Time Strategy game 3D engine coded in java 7.

name: Oxygine
description: C++ engine and framework for 2D games on iOS, Android, Windows, Linux and Mac.

name: panda.js
description: Free HTML5 game engine for mobile and desktop with Canvas and WebGL rendering.

name: Phaser
description: Phaser is a fun, free and fast 2D game framework for making HTML5 games for desktop and mobile web browsers, supporting Canvas and WebGL rendering.

name: PhysicsJavaScript
description: Modular, extendable, and easy-to-use physics engine for JavaScript.

name: pixi.js
description: Super fast HTML 5 2D rendering engine that uses webGL with canvas fallback.

name: Plasma
description: Cyan Worlds's Plasma game engine.

name: PlayCanvas
description: 3D WebGL game engine with online toolset.

name: QICI Engine
description: Free JavaScript game engine library with a web-based comprehensive suite of toolset for making HTML5 games.

name: Quasi-Engine
description: QtQuick framework that intends to be a complete toolset to ease 2d game development.

name: Ren'py
description: A Visual Novel Engine, written in python, for both mobile (iOS beta) and desktop platforms.

name: SFML
description: Simple and Fast Multimedia Library.

name: Solarus
description: An Action-RPG game engine written in C++.

name: Spring
description: Real Time Strategy game engine.

name: Starling
description: ActionScript 3 library that mimics the conventional Flash display tree architecture, can be deployed to mobile devices (iOS, Android), the desktop (Windows, macOS), and to the browser (via the Flash plugin).

name: Superpowers
description: TypeScript & ThreeJavaScript powered game engine and framework (2D & 3D with WebGL).

name: Tesseract
description: Make mapping more fun by using modern dynamic rendering techniques, sothat you can get instant feedback on lighting changes, not just geometry.

name: Three.js
description: JavaScript 3D library used in many browser games.

name: Tiled
description: Tiled is a general purpose tile map editor. It is meant to be used for editing maps of any tile-based game, be it an RPG, a platformer or a Breakout clone.

name: Torque 2D
description: MIT Licensed version of Torque 2D from GarageGames.

name: Torque 3D
description: MIT Licensed version of Torque 3D from GarageGames.

name: Turbulenz Engine
description: HTML5 game engine and server-side APIs available in JavaScript and TypeScript for building and distributing 2D and 3D games.

name: Urho3D
description: Urho3D is a free lightweight, cross-platform 2D and 3D game engine implemented in C++ and released under the MIT license. Greatly inspired by OGRE and Horde3D.

name: Wurfel Engine
description: An isometric game engine for games with an open world made of blocks or voxels.

name: XLE
description: Rendering engine with advanced features such as Image Based Lighting, dynamic area lights, and a node based material editor. Flexible and modular, it is designed to drop into existing solutions. XLE is the "hackable" engine, intended to be customised for specialised requirements.

name: Bfxr
description: Flash + AIR sound effects generator. Based on Sfxr.

name: Brood War API
description: C++ framework to interact with the Real Time Strategy (RTS) game Starcraft: Broodwar.

name: FlxCollisions
description: Simple set of 2d physics + collision demos for flixel v2.0.

name: Gamertag
description: Gem for retrieving Xbox Live Gamertag information from various sources.

name: Greenworks
description: A Node.js addon allowing you to integrate HTML5 game with Steamworks.

name: Halo::Reach::API
description: Ruby gem for interacting with the Halo:Reach API.

name: IodineGBA
description: GameBoy Advance emulator written entirely in JavaScript and powered by HTML5.

name: Itch
description: An electron cross-platform game downloader, installer, and library manager for itch.io written in TypeScript.

name: JavaScript Breakouts
description: Collection of JavaScript engine implementations of Breakout.

name: Leaderboard(Java)
description: Leaderboards backed by Redis(in Java).

name: Leaderboard(PHP)
description: Leaderboards backed by Redis(in PHP).

name: Leaderboard(Python)
description: Leaderboards backed by Redis(in Python).

name: Leaderboard(Ruby)
description: Leaderboards backed by Redis(in Ruby).

name: Leaderboard(Scala)
description: Leaderboards backed by Redis (in Scala).

name: libfreenect
description: Drivers and libraries for the Xbox Kinect device on WIndows, Linux, and macOS.

name: OpenEmu
description: Project to bring game emulation to macOS as a first class citizen.

name: Mudlet
description: A cross-platform, open source, and super fast MUD (text-only MMORPGs) client with scripting in Lua.

name: Stats.js
description: JavaScript performance monitor.

name: Tassadar
description: Starcraft 2 replay parser written in pure Ruby.

name: World of Warcraft Addons
description: Various World of Warcraft addons written in Lua.

name: World of Warcraft API Docs
description: Public documentation for the RESTful web service provided as part of the World of Warcraft community site.
